unicode.value: Amazing inventions
Equipo REA

En este REA vamos a aprender acerca de algunos de los descubrimientos más importantes de la historia, al mismo tiempo, aprenderemos vocabulario y contenidos relacionados con los inventos, todo ello, con el objetivo principal de preparar a nuestro alumnado para la consecución de la tarea final que proponemos: Creación de un lapbook en el que se describa el prototipo, idea o producto que ellos mismos han inventado. Tras ello, con apoyo visual del lapbook, se llevará a cabo una presentación oral de dicho invento y una exposición con todos los materiales creados.
master class
closed exercise or problem
real project
didactic game
open problem

Sección
Amazing inventions
Text and Tasks
1. Open your mind!

Dictionary

Invention

Definition:

Something that has never been made before.

Algo que no ha sido creado nunca antes.

Example:

The world is easier after the invention of the phone.

El mundo es más fácil tras el invento del teléfono.

Spanish word:

Invento

Audio:

Inventor

Definition:

Someone who has invented something or whose job is to invent things.

Alguien que ha inventado algo o cuyo trabajo es inventar cosas.

Example:

Alfred Nobel was the inventor of dynamite.

Alfred Nobel fue el inventor de la dinamita.

Spanish word:

Inventor o inventora

Audio:

Recycle

Definition:

To treat rubbish to produce materials that can be used again.

Tratar la basura para producir materiales que pueden ser usados de nuevo.

Example:

I recycle plastic, paper and glass.

Yo reciclo plástico, papel y vidrio.

Spanish word:

Reciclar

Audio:
Text and Tasks
1. Do you want to change the world? Let's do it!

Do you like inventions? Do you know inventions that changed the world? Do you want to become an inventor and change the planet?

Definition:

Something that has been designed or made for the first time.

Algo que ha sido diseñado o fabricado por primera vez.

Example:

An invention for saving electricity.

Un invento para ahorrar en electricidad.

Read

You are going to be an inventor.

You are going to change the planet.

Tú vas a cambiar el planeta.

Text and Tasks
2. 3,2,1,... Downloading new inventors

Dictionary

Environment

Definition:

The natural world, including the land, water, air, plants, and animals.

El mundo natural incluyendo la tierra, agua, aire, plantas y animales.

Example:

We must protect the environment.

Nosotros debemos proteger el medioambiente.

Spanish word:

Medioambiente

Audio:

Glass

Definition:

A hard clear substance used for making objects such as windows or bottles.

Sustancia dura usada para hacer objetos como ventanas o botellas.

Example:

The bottle is made of glass.

La botella está hecha de cristal.

Spanish word:

Cristal

Audio:

Make a better world

Definition:

Actions to make a more sustainable world.

Acciones para hacer un mundo más sostenible.

Example:

Recycling makes a better world.

Reciclar hace un mundo mejor.

Spanish word:

Hacer un mundo mejor

Audio:

Make up

Definition:

To invent something new.

Inventar algo nuevo.

Example:

I make up a story about my cat.

Yo invento una historia sobre mi gato.

Spanish word:

Inventar

Audio:

Metal

Definition:

A hard, usually shiny element that exists naturally in the ground or in rock.

Elemento duro, generalmente brillante, que existe de forma natural en el suelo o en roca.

Example:

Keys are made of metal.

Las llaves están hechas de metal.

Spanish word:

Metal

Audio:

Modern

Definition:

Related to the present time.

Relacionado con el tiempo presente.

Example:

Smartphones are a modern invention.

Los smartphones son un invento moderno.

Spanish word:

Moderno

Audio:

Old

Definition:

Adjective to talk about something that has existed or has been used for many years.

Adjetivo para hablar sobre algo que ha existido o ha sido usado durante muchos años.

Example:

Airplanes are an old invention.

Los aviones son un invento antiguo.

Spanish word:

Viejo/Antiguo

Audio:

Paper

Definition:

Thin and flat material that you can use to write.

Material fino y plano que puedes usar para escribir.

Example:

I need a paper to write the letter.

Necesito un papel para escribir la carta.

Spanish word:

Papel

Audio:

Plastic

Definition:

Light, strong and chemical substance used to make different objects such as toys.

Sustancia ligera, fuerte y química usada para hacer objetos diferentes como juguetes.

Example:

This toy is made of plastic.

Este juguete está hecho de plástico.

Spanish word:

Plástico

Audio:

Printing press

Definition:

A machine that is used for printing newspapers, books, magazines etc.

Máquina que se usa para imprimir periódicos, libros, revistas, etc.

Example:

The printing press was an incredible invention.

La imprenta fue una invención increíble.

Spanish word:

Imprenta

Audio:

Steam machine

Definition:

An engine that gets its power from steam, especially a railway engine.

Una locomotora que obtiene su energía del vapor, especialmente una locomotora de ferrocarril.

Example:

Thanks to the steam machine people could travel.

Gracias a la máquina de vapor la gente pudo viajar.

Spanish word:

Máquina de vapor

Audio:

Wheel

Definition:

A round object that turns to make a car, bike or another vehicle move.

Objeto redondo que gira para hacer a un coche, una bici u otro vehículo moverse.

Example:

The wheels of my bike are small.

Las ruedas de mi bici son pequeñas.

Spanish word:

Rueda

Audio:

DropDown exercises are texts or sentences where students must select the correct words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Choose words in the text that are key to understanding the concepts. These will probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge
If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
Enter any feedback you wish to provide the learner with-in the feedback field. This field can be left blank.

7. I organize to invent

We are going to learn to face new tasks, activities and exercises.

This time you are going to manage and plan all the information to memorize and make a diagram with the main ideas of your invention. The steps to follow, extract the main ideas, memorize the materials, size, invention and recycling to make your lapbook.

To get started, click this button or image to go to “My Learning Notebook” and complete the first step. (I identify what I have to do).

Document to fill out (Opens in a new window)

¿Necesitas más ayuda?

Vamos a aprender a enfrentarnos a nuevas tareas, actividades y ejercicios.

En esta ocasión vas a gestionar y planificar toda la información para memorizar y hacer un esquema con las ideas principales de tu invento . Los pasos a seguir:

  1. Extraer las ideas principales
  2. Memorizar los materiales
  3. Tamaño
  4. Invento 
  5. Reciclado

 Para hacer tu lapbook

Para comenzar, haz clic en este botón o imagen para ir a “Mi cuaderno de aprendizaje” y completa el primer paso. (Pienso en lo que tengo que hacer).
Text and Tasks
3. Time to explore inventions!

Dictionary

Advertisement

Definition:

A picture, short film, etc. that is designed to persuade people to buying something.

Una fotografía, vídeo corto, etc. diseñado para convencer a la gente de que compre algo.

Example:

I watched an advertisement of a new car.

Yo vi un anuncio de un coche nuevo.

Spanish word:

Anuncio

Audio:

Delivery

Definition:

The act of taking things to a person or place.

Acción de llevar cosas a personas o lugares.

Example:

A truck makes hundreds of deliveries everyday.

Un camión realizar cientos de repartos al día.

Spanish word:

Reparto

Audio:

Sales

Definition:

A product reduced in price.

Producto con su precio reducido.

Example:

The shops usually have sales after Christmas.

Las tiendas normalmente tienen ofertas después de las Navidades.

Spanish word:

Rebajas

Audio:

Skateboard

Definition:

A board with wheels on the bottom that you stand on and move forward by pushing one foot on the ground.

Tabla con ruedas en la parte inferior sobre la que te pones de pie y te mueves hacia delante empujando con un pie sobre el suelo.

Example:

She uses her skateboard everyday.

Ella utiliza su patinete todos los días.

Spanish word:

Patinete

Audio:

Do you remember the colors? 

Have a look at this video and sing with me:

"The rainbow color song".

Although more often used in formal testing situations MCQs can be used as a testing tool to stimulate thought and discussion on topics students may feel a little reticent in responding to. When designing a MCQ test consider the following:
  • What learning outcomes are the questions testing
  • What intellectual skills are being tested
  • What are the language skills of the audience
  • Gender and cultural issues
  • Avoid grammar language and question structures that might provide clues
Enter the question stem. The quest should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.

When building an MCQ consider the following:
  • Use phrases that learners are familiar with and have encountered in their study
  • Keep responses concise
  • There should be some consistency between the stem and the responses
  • Provide enough options to challenge learners to think about their response
  • Try to make sure that correct responses are not more detailed than the distractors
  • Distractors should be incorrect but plausible

You have already started the activity "Unity is strength"! Beginnings can create fears and insecurities.

If you complete STEP 1 of the Learning Journal (Will I be able to do it?) you will see that your feelings are normal when we start a task. To do this, you must organize your ideas through strategies that help you remember the information.

Good luck, you'll do great!

Dictionary

Cheap

Definition:

Something costing less than usual.

Algo que cuesta menos de lo normal.

Example:

That car is cheap, you don't need a lot of money to buy it.

Ese coche es barato, tú no necesitas mucho dinero para comprarlo.

Spanish word:

Barato

Audio:

Expensive

Definition:

Costing a lot of money.

Algo que cuesta mucho dinero.

Example:

That car is expensive you need a lot of money to buy it.

Ese coche es caro, necesitas mucho dinero para comprarlo.

Spanish word:

Caro

Audio:

Fair

Definition:

An event to show some products or services.

Un evento para mostrar algunos productos o servicios.

Example:

There is an invention fair at the school.

Hay una feria de inventos en el colegio.

Spanish word:

Feria

Audio:

Heavy

Definition:

Something that weighs a lot.

Algo que pesa mucho.

Example:

A ship is heavy.

Un barco es pesado.

Spanish word:

Pesado

Audio:

Iron

Definition:

A dark grey metal.

Metal oscuro y gris.

Example:

A car is made of iron.

Un coche está hecho de hierro.

Spanish word:

Hierro

Audio:

Lapbook

Definition:

Cardboard book used to present information about a topic.

Libro de cartulina que se utiliza para presentar la información acerca de un tema.

Example:

We made a Science lapbook.

Nosotros hicimos un lapbook de ciencias.

Spanish word:

Lapbook

Audio:

Shape

Definition:

The physical form of something.

La forma física de algo.

Example:

I cut circular shapes.

Yo corté formas circulares.

Spanish word:

Formas

Audio:

Although more often used in formal testing situations MCQs can be used as a testing tool to stimulate thought and discussion on topics students may feel a little reticent in responding to. When designing a MCQ test consider the following:
  • What learning outcomes are the questions testing
  • What intellectual skills are being tested
  • What are the language skills of the audience
  • Gender and cultural issues
  • Avoid grammar language and question structures that might provide clues
Enter the question stem. The quest should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.

When building an MCQ consider the following:
  • Use phrases that learners are familiar with and have encountered in their study
  • Keep responses concise
  • There should be some consistency between the stem and the responses
  • Provide enough options to challenge learners to think about their response
  • Try to make sure that correct responses are not more detailed than the distractors
  • Distractors should be incorrect but plausible
Enter the question stem. The quest should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.

9. Will you be able to do this activity?

To reach a goal, you should be a good strategist. That is, having methods, techniques, “tricks” to get to where you want to be before or more easily.

Now I am going to teach you a strategy, take advantage of it to reach your challenge!

The strategy is to memorize information through problem solving. This will help you through information organizers such as the lapbook that you are going to create.

You can find everything you need about this strategy in the following link to the Learn to Learn Guide.

¿Necesitas más ayuda?

Para llegar a una meta, es conveniente que seas un buen o buena estratega. Es decir, tener métodos, técnicas, "trucos" para llegar antes o de forma más fácil donde tú quieres.

Ahora te voy a enseñar una estrategia, ¡Aprovéchala para alcanzar tu reto!

La estrategia es memorizar información a través para resolver problemas. Este te ayudará a través de organizadores de la información como el lapbook que vas a crear. 

Podrás encontrar todo lo que necesitas sobre esta estrategia en el siguiente enlace a la Guía de la Competencia de Aprender a Aprender.

¡Ánimo, que lo harás genial!

Enter any feedback you wish to provide to the learner. This field may be left blank. if this field is left blank default feedback will be provided.

True/false questions present a statement where the learner must decide if the statement is true. This type of question works well for factual information and information that lends itself to either/or responses.
Type the question stem. The question should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.

Text and Tasks
Option D: Look for a perfect invention

Look for a perfect invention or product with these characteristics.

  • Invention/product number 1: Expensive and small.
  • Invention/product number 2: Resistant, light and cheap.
  • Invention/product 3: Modern, electric and heavy.
  • Invention/product 4: Big, original, modern and expensive.

Write the answers in your notebook.

Dictionary

Fair

Definition:

An event to show some products or services.

Un evento para mostrar algunos productos o servicios.

Example:

There is an invention fair at the school.

Hay una feria de inventos en el colegio.

Spanish word:

Feria

Audio:

Outfit

Definition:

A set of clothes used in a particular and special occasion or activity.

Conjunto de ropa usada en una ocasión o actividad particular o especial.

Example:

This is a perfect outfit for the party.

Es un vestuario perfecto para la fiesta.

Spanish word:

Vestuario

La información más importante de algo.

Resumen

Apaga la radio, por favor.

Text and Tasks
Créditos
Autoría

Título Amazing inventions
Descripción

A través de este REA el alumnado será capaz de:

  • Aprender a describir objetos.
  • Conocer inventos importantes a lo largo de la historia.
  • Exponer un invento.
  • Valorar la importancia de utilizar materiales sostenibles y reciclables.

Tarea final: Creación de un lapbook en el que se describa el prototipo, idea o producto que ellos mismos han inventado. Tras ello, con apoyo visual del lapbook, se llevará a cabo una presentación oral de dicho invento y una exposición con todos los materiales creados.

Other Contents
Equipo REA

En este REA vamos a aprender acerca de algunos de los descubrimientos más importantes de la historia, al mismo tiempo, aprenderemos vocabulario y contenidos relacionados con los inventos, todo ello, con el objetivo principal de preparar a nuestro alumnado para la consecución de la tarea final que proponemos: Creación de un lapbook en el que se describa el prototipo, idea o producto que ellos mismos han inventado. Tras ello, con apoyo visual del lapbook, se llevará a cabo una presentación oral de dicho invento y una exposición con todos los materiales creados.
